item.title: Git line ending config
item.description: This post is about how to set up Git so that people using different operating systems can work in the same repository, without messing up the line ending of source files.

item.title: Push to GitHub with Personal Access Token (PAT)
item.description: To promote security, starting from Aug. 2021, many GitHub operations require use of personal access tokens (PAT).

item.title: Merging Branches with Git Rebase
item.description: When merging branches, the most direct way we can use is to git merge. However, with git-merge, the commit history and graph will be messy if there are a lot of branches.

item.description: When we run git-diff, git uses its internal diff algorithm to generate diff for changed files.

item.title: Is GitHub Down Today?
item.description:
update:

  • On 2021-11-28, we expericence another GitHub outage which lasts more than two hours, see here.

On 2021-08-10 23:30 CST, I observed that I cannot push to my GitHub repo even with --force. After checking the GitHub status site, it seems that the GitHub API is down1.

It is not the first time that GitHub is down. There has been several failure reports last year (2020), due to MySQL and other issues.

At this moment, I have realized how much I and other developers around world are relying on this free service.

item.title: Show Git Diff When Doing Git Commit
item.description: I saw on YouTube a video made by TJ DeVries on how to contribute to the neovim project. There is a scene where he commit via git commit, and whoa, a Neovim instance appeared with three split, with top left the commit message area, top right the git-status area, and on the right the git-diff info, which is really cool.

item.title: How To Install Latest Version of Git on Linux
item.description:
Update log

2021-12-10: update endpoint rpm link for git

The version of the default git bundled with the Linux system is often too old, and lacks certain features, which may break some tools. This post summarizes how to install newer versions of Git on Linux.

item.title: Resolving Merge Conflict after Git Stash Pop
item.description: Sometimes, when we are working with our local changes in a Git repo, we may want to pull the latest updates from the remote repository. To avoid code conflict between remote files and local files. We can use git stash to store the unfinished local work temporarily.

item.title: How to Push Local Git Repo to Remote Repo in GitHub
item.description:
There are two basic cases when we push our local repo to remote repo. These two cases differ in their settings. But sometimes, we are easily confused.

First scenario
#

The first case is that you have created a local repo and want to store it on GitHub later. In this case, your usual work flow for local repo is:
